Title: Real-time Video Call Anti-Aliasing using On-Device Generative AI
Problem Statement: Develop a real-time anti-aliasing solution for video calls on smartphones, leveraging generative AI to reconstruct high-frequency details lost during compression and transmission, enhancing visual quality for users.
Description: Video calls often suffer from aliasing artifacts due to bandwidth limitations and compression. This project explores the use of generative adversarial networks (GANs) or diffusion models to intelligently reconstruct lost details, providing a smoother and more natural viewing experience. Focus will be on on-device implementation for low latency.
Challenge / Use Case: Improving the visual quality of low-bandwidth video calls, especially in challenging network conditions.
Deliverables: Android app prototype with real-time anti-aliasing, fine-tuned generative model, performance evaluation report.
Prerequisites: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) or Diffusion Models
Infrastructure Requirements: Standard Android smartphone for testing. GPU-enabled machine for model training (Google Colab sufficient).
Tentative Tech Stack: Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, TensorFlow Lite, Android Studio, OpenCV.

Milestones (6 months).M2: Dataset creation and baseline GAN/Diffusion model implementation.
Milestones (6 months).M4: Model optimization for on-device performance and integration with a basic video calling app.
Milestones (6 months).M6: Fully functional Android app with real-time anti-aliasing, performance evaluation, and report.

Title: AI-Powered Noise Reduction for Voice Calls in IoT Environments
Problem Statement: Develop an on-device AI-powered noise reduction algorithm for voice calls originating from IoT devices (smart home, wearables), mitigating background noise and improving speech clarity.
Description: IoT devices often operate in noisy environments. This project focuses on creating a robust noise reduction solution that can be deployed directly on the device, reducing latency and improving the user experience. This utilizes voice AI techniques such as spectral subtraction and deep learning based noise suppression.
Challenge / Use Case: Improving voice communication quality in noisy IoT environments, enhancing usability and accessibility.
Deliverables: Embedded noise reduction module for IoT devices (simulated or prototype), trained deep learning model, performance evaluation report.
Infrastructure Requirements: Microcontroller/Raspberry Pi for prototyping. PC for model training. Microphone array for data collection (optional).
Tentative Tech Stack: Python, TensorFlow Lite, C/C++, Raspberry Pi, TensorFlow, PyTorch.

Milestones (6 months).M2: Data collection and preprocessing. Implementation of baseline noise reduction algorithms.
Milestones (6 months).M4: Training and optimization of deep learning models for noise reduction.
Milestones (6 months).M6: Deployment on embedded platform, performance evaluation, and documentation.

Title: Vision AI-Based Smart Object Recognition for AR Shopping
Problem Statement: Develop a real-time object recognition system for Augmented Reality (AR) shopping applications, enabling users to identify products in their environment and receive relevant information.
Description: This project aims to enhance the AR shopping experience by leveraging vision AI to recognize objects in a user's camera view. The system will identify products, provide pricing, specifications, and enable virtual try-on or placement. This combines classical computer vision and deep learning techniques.
Challenge / Use Case: Improving the convenience and engagement of AR shopping applications.
Deliverables: Android AR app with object recognition functionality, trained object detection model, performance evaluation report.
Prerequisites: Object Detection Algorithms (YOLO, SSD, Faster R-CNN)
Infrastructure Requirements: Android smartphone with ARCore support. GPU-enabled machine for model training.
Tentative Tech Stack: Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, TensorFlow Lite, Android Studio, ARCore.

Milestones (6 months).M2: Dataset creation and training of object detection model.
Milestones (6 months).M4: Integration of model with ARCore and development of basic AR shopping app.
Milestones (6 months).M6: User interface enhancements, performance optimization, and evaluation.

Title: AI-Driven Predictive Maintenance for IoT Sensors
Problem Statement: Develop a machine learning model to predict potential failures in IoT sensor networks, enabling proactive maintenance and reducing downtime.
Description: This project explores the use of machine learning to analyze data from IoT sensors (temperature, humidity, pressure, etc.) and predict when a sensor is likely to fail. This enables proactive maintenance, reducing downtime and improving system reliability. Utilizes time series analysis and anomaly detection techniques.
Challenge / Use Case: Improving the reliability and reducing the maintenance costs of IoT deployments.
Deliverables: Machine learning model for failure prediction, data analysis pipeline, performance evaluation report.
Prerequisites: Machine Learning Algorithms (Regression, Classification, Time Series Analysis)
Infrastructure Requirements: Access to IoT sensor data (simulated or real). PC for model training and evaluation.
Tentative Tech Stack: Python, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, Cloud Platform (AWS, Azure, GCP).

Milestones (6 months).M2: Data collection and preprocessing. Feature engineering and model selection.
Milestones (6 months).M4: Model training and validation. Performance evaluation and optimization.
Milestones (6 months).M6: Deployment and integration with a monitoring system (optional). Documentation and report.

Title: Smart Home Energy Management with Reinforcement Learning
Problem Statement: Develop a reinforcement learning agent to optimize energy consumption in a smart home, considering user preferences and real-time energy prices.
Description: This project aims to create an intelligent energy management system for smart homes. The system will learn to control appliances (lighting, HVAC, etc.) to minimize energy costs while maintaining user comfort. Reinforcement learning will be used to adapt to changing conditions and user habits.
Challenge / Use Case: Reducing energy consumption and costs in smart homes.
Deliverables: Reinforcement learning agent for energy management, simulation environment, performance evaluation report.
Infrastructure Requirements: PC for simulation and model training.
Tentative Tech Stack: Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, OpenAI Gym (or similar simulation environment).

Milestones (6 months).M2: Development of a smart home simulation environment. Implementation of a baseline control policy.
Milestones (6 months).M4: Training and evaluation of reinforcement learning agent. Hyperparameter tuning and optimization.
Milestones (6 months).M6: Performance comparison with baseline policy. Documentation and report.
